p.s: In Barack Obama's speech about the importance of intercultural understanding and student exchanges, he claims that simple exchanges can break down walls between us (l. 13).
In the following, I will comment on that opinion.
First of all, student exchanges help to understand each other's cultural values better.
Getting past stereotypes and prejudices is an advantage, no one could deny.
Even if some exchange students make bad experiences abroad, the majority won't.
Our world is as connected as never before.
Globalization and the internet, influence our life everyday.
Cross-cultural experiences like meditation in Europe or America are normal.
So why shouldn't we break down [those last] walls?
Exchanges will help us to apprechiateappreciate the exchange country and our own as well, but in different ways.
Another wall, that still is a big problemeproblem are understanding problems.
So, I truely think, we should learn [more] new languages (l. 10) to be fully connected.
A simple exchange (l. 13) will defenetlydefinitely guarantee you an improving in your language skills.

After wheighingweighing and comparing both sides, I think we can agree with Obama that simple exchanges can break down walls (l. 13) between different cultures because you are able to get a better understanding on each other's traditions and values.
